programme.title: Fresh Quilting
programme.desc: Explore design from a fresh perspective. Free-motion quilt artist Christina Cameli echo quilts and contrasts curves and lines to create new designs. Art historian and quilter Allison Evans joins modern quilt activist Heather Grant to discuss charity quilting events. Quilt innovator Jacquie Gering quilts with gentle curves.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: What do you get when you combine a rainbow quilt, a star quilt and a medallion quilt all into one? A fresh episode of "The Midnight Quilt Show," of course! Join Angela as she breaks down Y-seams, quilting with templates and beyond.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.sub-title: Bonus: How to Cut T-Shirts for a Quilt
programme.desc: Angela shares her top three tips on how to cut t-shirts for a quilt.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Quilting just got better. Join Angela in her first episode as she stitches up her exclusive variable-star quilt design.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Even super heroes need a little help every once in a while, our sewing machine comes to the rescue with today's projects. Teacher Ellen Miller has a little bobbin magic as she introduces us to Sashiko, a couture technique that adds so many dimensions to your sewing. Then practice a little machine wizardry with Joanne Banko. Even the most basic machine includes super sewing stitches that can make your sewing more professional. Learn how easy it is to get super results using stretch stitches, overcast, basting, and blind hem and even buttonhole stitches for super results.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.sub-title: The Late Teens - Everything Had Changed
programme.desc: As the war ended, people dressed up more. Coleen Swettman uses computerized embroidery technology to create free-standing lace for accessories, collars, cuffs and trim. Women wore bloomers for sports like swimming, tennis, basketball and bowling. Tina Givens shows how to update the original bloomers to wear today. Lynn Lunoe shows how to create charming doll fashions faster than ever.

programme.title: Beads, Baubles & Jewels
programme.desc: It's fun to bead with friends. With a color palette for inspiration, Erin Prais-Hintz spills her beading secrets as she and Katie plan a beading party and give you more ideas for jewelry-making get-togethers. Katie uses vintage-style sliders to make glamorous chandelier earrings.

programme.title: Beads, Baubles & Jewels
programme.desc: Wrap bracelets and wire wrapping are just two ways to get wrapped up in beads. Katie shows how to embellish flip flops, Barb Switzer creates wire wrapped chandelier earrings, Erin Siegel demonstrates a leather wrap bracelet, and last featured are stacking wired bracelets; wrap it today, wear it tonight and love it every day.

programme.title: Scrapbook Soup
programme.desc: Use cutting tools, stamps, pens and markers to make customized embellishments. Julie shows how to embellish paper flowers with watercolor markers for her page layout. Next, Jenn Mason demonstrates how to make fabric tape. Then, Joe Rotella uses paper collage with scraps to cover a wooden tea box. Last, Julie uses several techniques to embellish a paper tag.

programme.title: Make It Artsy
programme.desc: Add a different tool, a new surface, or just make a subtle change to shape up your techniques. First, host Julie Fei Fan Balzer creates a handmade journal cover using watercolor powders. Next, Micah Goguen shares a technique for creating frosted vintage botanicals. Then, Sandy McTier has a few tricks for decorative painting with her festive pumpkins project. Last is a color study -- the color grey.

programme.title: Shawl Lovers
programme.desc: Learn to knit with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Knitting
programme.desc: Learn to knit with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Are you a "slow and steady" quilter or more of a "forget perfect, finish fast" quilter like Angela? Tonight, she uses templates and block piecing with LOTS of triangles to create an out-of-this-world ombré quilt. Plus, she shares some handy tips for quilting with rulers.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: This week, Angela gets right to machine quilting to help you finish your quilts once and for all. (Because a finished quilt is always better than a perfect quilt top!)

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Believe it or not, this quilt is only made of straight seams! Watch it "unfold" as Angela conquers the Strip City pattern with Boundless blues.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.sub-title: Bonus: 5 Items Around Your House to Use for Quilting
programme.desc: From cornstarch to cuticle pushers, Angela shares five ingenious hacks for using common household items for quilting.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: This practical and cute quilted zipper pouch is one of Angela's favorite projects yet, because it skips the piecing and gets straight to the quilting! In this episode, she shares three quilting designs every quilter should know: ribbon candy, serpentine lines and the paisley feather, while making a small, easy quilting project for beginners that only requires two fat quarters to make!

programme.title: Butter Book
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Craft Hacks
programme.desc: Time-saving quick tips to feed your crafting craving.

programme.title: CraftsyTV Quick Tips
programme.desc: Sewing experts offer easy ways to create neat sewing projects right at home. Viewers of all skill levels learn tips and techniques for creating professional-looking garments, personalized apparel and home accents. Weekly episodes feature various themes, and feature two main projects and one shorter technique segment. Some projects include monogramming napkins and towels; baby poncho, hooded towel and baby-friendly diapers; embellishing yoga pants with a clothing tattoo; and sewing on knits.

programme.title: Slow TV
programme.desc: Take it slow with this model railroad tour.

programme.title: Slow TV
programme.desc: Take it slow with this model railroad tour.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Joshua John Russell creates modern, edible masterpieces with cake, fondant and buttercream.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Sink your teeth into current cake decorating trends! In the Man About Cake series, Joshua John Russell delivers incredible tips for creating modern edible masterpieces. Each week, he decorates an original cake, shares his favorite recipes and gives pointers for designing like a pro.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: An all-white cake doesn't have to be plain. JJR is back and bolder than ever with this four-tier white monochrome wedding cake.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: An all-white cake doesn't have to be plain. JJR is back and bolder than ever with this four-tier white monochrome wedding cake.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Marble cakes rock. In this episode our Cake Slayer demystifies the marbled fondant technique and constructs a fully marbleized cake (from the inside out!). If only granite had chocolate swirls like these.

programme.title: Butter Book
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Garden Party
programme.desc: Ready to dig in and grow your green thumb? Join us for a delightful hour of expert-led gardening tutorials designed to inspire and educate gardeners of all levels. From essential planting tips and soil secrets to creative container gardening and vibrant floral arrangements, our seasoned instructors will guide you through every step. Whether you're a seasoned horticulturist or just starting out, you'll find fresh ideas and practical techniques to cultivate the garden of your dreams.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: Music inspires creativity and adds to the fun. To keep the beat, Jenny Barnett-Rohrs makes a drum. Katie Hacker makes a jingly bell bracelet and Franz Spohn illustrates great musical works. Jenny has a wonderful gift idea for a sports fan from blogger Morena Hockley.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: Break the creative boundaries and travel to the outer limits. Blast off as Jenny Barnett-Rohrs makes a bottle rocket. Katie Hacker tracks the journey on a decorated bulletin board. Franz Spohn makes portraits with candy beads and we'll make a sparkly Easter decoration from blogger Jen Goode.

programme.title: Figure Drawing: An Essential Guide
programme.desc: Learn to draw and paint with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Perfect Pizza at Home
programme.desc: Learn to cook with CraftsyTV

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Looking for a fun beginner-friendly quilt? Angela’s got you covered with a super simple pattern that leaves plenty of room for the quilting — easy cutting, easy piecing, easy peasy!

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela is kicking off Season 7 of the Midnight Quilt Show with a redemption story. She’s made this Thistle quilt pattern before with half-square triangles but thinks this flying-geese version will be much easier to quilt.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: CAUTION: Baby quilts are a total gateway drug! Just ask Angela: she's working this cute little number up for her newborn nephew. (Think you can stop at one? Don't say we didn't warn you!)

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: This week, Angela's quilting a stash-busting table runner that's perfect for entertaining (plus, quick to whip up!), and sharing her favorite tips for throwing the perfect party!

programme.title: Craft Hacks
programme.desc: Time-saving quick tips to feed your crafting craving.

programme.title: Butter Book
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: This episode features a wardrobe staple - playful pants. Joanne Banko creates cropped pants with a designer hem treatment. Then, it's trendy draw string waist pants with Angela Wolf. This legging variation has a flattering, comfortable fit for most body types.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Garments get a makeover on today's show. You can make the same pattern over and over again but it will look totally different depending on your fabric and color choice and other surface embellishments. Angela Wolf begins with a beautiful and traditional sheath dress. An intricate applique trim completely changes this basic silhouette. Then, embroidery expert Eileen Roche demonstrates simple monogram techniques for all different garments -- it's a traditional look updated with a contemporary approach.

programme.title: Off Our Needles
programme.desc: Stressed out? Don't let life unravel, knit something easy and unwind! All you need is this zen garden of simple project picks, courtesy of our resident knit therapists. (Paging doctors Jodi and Tracie.)

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: We create some new locations for creative play as we change the setting around us. We start out with a tree that reflects the changing seasons. Then, we'll make a play tent for imaginary adventures. The next page of our art journal is a surreal collage from magazine cutouts. Last, we create a portable playscape of the forest.

programme.title: Woodworkers Guild of America presented by CraftsyTV
programme.sub-title: Ring Stand, Picture Frame, & Cutting Board
programme.desc: George Vondriska shows you how to create a handmade ring stand that's perfect for storing rings next to the sink, on a bedside table, or even in the workshop. Then, George demonstrates how to construct a custom photo frame to hold your favorite memories. Finally, learn to make an attractive cutting board that makes an excellent handmade gift.

programme.title: Fresh Quilting
programme.desc: Triangles and wedges are the building blocks of modern quilts. Color enthusiast Rebecca Bryan creates graphic quilt samplers with bold-colored triangles. Quilters Kara Sanders and Elizabeth Dackson talk about organizing quilting retreats that refuel creative energy. Designer Christina Cameli uses 10-degree triangles to create a versatile blocks for a variety of modern designs.
